titlestmt.titleproper: Commonwealth Fund records, Video Recordings, SG 1, Series 39
A Guide to the Commonwealth Fund records, Video Recordings, SG 1, Series 39 FA1286

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2020-09-01 00:14:03 -0400.

did.unittitle: Commonwealth Fund records, Video Recordings, SG 1, Series 39

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Records are open for research. Brittle or damaged items are available at the discretion of RAC.

When requesting to view audiovisual material, please refer to the Title and the AV Number (example: AV 1916). Researchers are asked to check the "Restrictions" note for each Title. If a Title does not currently have an access copy, please contact a RAC archivist for further instruction.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains video records from the Commonwealth Fund archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p:
Information regarding the Rockefeller Archive Center's preferred elements and forms of citation can be found at
http://www.rockarch.org/research/citations.php

did.unittitle: If I Don't Live to Be Tomorrow - Hospital Care for People with AIDS

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Access copy available.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Program includes interviews with New York City health care workers about tending to AIDS patients. Also includes interviews with AIDS patients describing their experiences within the hospital system. A Presentation of the New York City Health and Hospitals Corporation. Narrated by Colleen Dewhurst.

did.unittitle: An American Hero - The Story of Congressman John Lewis

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Access copy unavailable. Please contact a RAC archivist for further instruction.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Video relates the story of civil rights hero Congressman John Lewis. It highlights the use of nonviolence in sit-ins and at specific events, such as the Birmingham Church bombing and the March on Selma.
